title: Farm Machine Safety: Fueling and Daily Maintenance Safety

tasks.task: Fueling and maintaining tractors and farm equipment safely
subtasks: Refer operators' manuals for specific safety practices
Understand symbols and colors indicating hazardous situations
Pay attention to red, orange, and yellow warning colors
Read and comply with safety decals on equipment
Keep a first aid kit in tractors and self-propelled machines
Daily check necessary fluids as per operator's manual
Memorize locations of controls for quick emergency response
Follow safety procedures for refueling (cool engine, no smoking)
Clean up fuel spills immediately
Manage diesel exhaust fluid for tractors with SCR technology
Check engine, radiator, and transmission fluid levels daily
Inflate tires according to manufacturer's recommendations
Monitor tire condition for cuts, cracks, or damage
Ensure headlights, flashers, and brake lights are functional and clean
Comply with lighting requirements (forward lights, tail lights, flashers)
Maintain clear windows and mirrors for visibility
Securely fasten and check engine shields

tasks.task: Power hop prevention and tire inspection
subtasks: Inflate tires to correct pressure (avoid power hop)
Check tires for any damage (cuts, cracks, bruises)
Exercise extra caution when climbing ladders (e.g., wet or icy steps)
Take additional time for safety measures to prevent accidents
Remember that safety is the priority
